tit.cmt: タイトルではAsomi のみの表記としました。

sen.j: 朝臣（あそみ、あそん）は、684年（天武13）に制定された八色の姓（やくさのかばね）の制度で新たに作られたカバネ（かばね）で、上から二番目に相当する。
sen.e: Ason (or Asomi) was the second rank of Kabane which was created in a system of eight-rank clan titles established in 684.
Asomi (or Ason) (written as 朝臣) was the second rank of kabane (hereditary title) which was created in a system of Yakusa no Kabane (the eight honorary titles) established in 684.
sen.cmt: カバネ に補足を追加しました。下記で漢字表記の違いについて記述があるため、こちらでも朝臣を追加しました。
sen.e: Asomi (or Ason) (written as 朝臣) was the second rank of kabane (hereditary title) which was created in a system of Yakusa no Kabane (the eight honorary titles) established in 684.

sen.j: 一番上の真人（まひと）は、主に皇族に与えられたため、皇族以外の臣下の中では事実上一番上の地位にあたる。
sen.e: The first rank of mahito was effectively the highest title amid vassals other than the Imperial family because it was reserved exclusively for certain imperial clans.
Asomi was effectively the highest title amid vassals other than the Imperial Family because Mahito, which was the highest rank, was reserved exclusively for certain imperial clans.
sen.cmt: 翻訳を一部修正しました。
sen.e: Asomi was effectively the highest title amid vassals other than the Imperial Family because Mahito, which was the highest rank, was reserved exclusively for certain imperial clans.

sen.j: 読みは「あそみ」が古い。
sen.e: Saying 'Asomi' was older than the other.
Reading it as 'Asomi' is older than the other.
sen.cmt: 翻訳を一部修正しました。
sen.e: Reading it as 'Asomi' is older than the other.

sen.j: 古くは阿曽美、旦臣とも書いた。
sen.e: There were some forms of writing with Chinese characters.
It was also written as 阿曽美 or 旦臣 in olden days.
It was also written as 阿曽美 or 旦臣 in olden days.

sen.j: この朝臣が作られた背景には、従来から有った、臣（おみ）、連（むらじ）、首 (曖昧さ回避)（おびと）、直（あたい）などの姓（かばね）の上位に位置する姓（かばね）を作ることでした。
sen.e: The reason why Ason was introduced was to create a superior Kabane to the others such as Omi, Obito (曖昧さ回避), Atai or so on which had long been in existence.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処「曖昧さ回避」⇒意味解釈が困難なため訳出できず
sen.e: The reason why Asomi was introduced was to create a superior kabane to the others such as Omi, Muraji, Obito, Atai or so on which had long been in existence.
sen.cmt: 連 を追加しました。Ason→Asomi としました。
sen.e: The reason why Asomi was introduced was to create a superior kabane to the others such as Omi, Muraji, Obito, Atai or so on which had long been in existence.

sen.j: そして、姓に優劣、待遇の差をつけ、天皇家への忠誠の厚い氏（うじ）を優遇し、天皇家への権力掌握をはかったと思われる。
sen.e: And, with putting superiority or inferiority of Kabane and differences in status, an Uji (a clan) who felt loyal to the Imperial Family was favored to have authorities to the Imperial Family.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Furthermore, the Imperial Family is thought to have tried to seize power by making superior and inferior kabane to create differences in status and favoring certain uji (clan) who have strong loyalty to the Imperial Family.
sen.cmt: 翻訳を一部修正しました。
sen.e: Furthermore, the Imperial Family is thought to have tried to seize power by making superior and inferior kabane to create differences in status and favoring certain uji (clan) who have strong loyalty to the Imperial Family.

sen.j: 朝臣は、主に壬申の乱で功績の有った主に臣（おみ）の姓（かばね）を持つ氏族に優先的に与えられた。
sen.e: Ason was preferentially granted to the clans primarily who were acknowledged their achievement in the Jinshin War and had the Kabane of Omi.
Asomi was mainly preferentially granted to the clans whose achievement was acknowledged in the Jinshin War and who had the kabane of Omi.
sen.cmt: 翻訳を一部修正しました。
sen.e: Asomi was mainly preferentially granted to the clans whose achievement was acknowledged in the Jinshin War and who had the kabane of Omi.

sen.j: その次に位置する主に連（むらじ）の姓（かばね）を持つ氏族には宿禰（すくね）の姓を与えていた。
sen.e: The clans with the Kabane of Muraji which was the next rank of Omi were given the Kabane of Sukune.
The clans with the kabane of Muraji which was the next rank under Omi were given the kabane of Sukune.
sen.cmt: kabane 小文字としました。
sen.e: The clans with the kabane of Muraji which was the next rank under Omi were given the kabane of Sukune.

sen.j: しかしながら、その後も朝廷に功績が有った氏族には朝臣の姓を下賜していき、奈良時代にはほとんどの氏が朝臣の姓を持つようになった。
sen.e: Later, as the clans who were recognized their contributions to the Imperial Court were granted the Kabane of Ason, most of clans in the Nara Period had the Kabane of Ason.
Later, however, as the clans who contributed to the Imperial Court were granted the kabane of Asomi, most clans in the Nara period had the kabane of Asomi.
sen.cmt: Asomi としました。Period を小文字にしました。
sen.e: Later, however, as the clans who contributed to the Imperial Court were granted the kabane of Asomi, most clans in the Nara period had the kabane of Asomi.

sen.j: さらに時代が下ると、大半の貴族や武士は藤原氏朝臣、源氏朝臣、平氏朝臣などの子孫で占められてしまった。
sen.e: As time passed, most of nobles and Samurai were descendants of Fujiwara no Asomi, Minamoto no Asomi and Taira no Asomi.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: As time further passed, most nobles and samurai were descendants of Fujiwara no Asomi, Minamoto no Asomi and Taira no Asomi.
sen.cmt: 翻訳を一部修正しました。
sen.e: As time further passed, most nobles and samurai were descendants of Fujiwara no Asomi, Minamoto no Asomi and Taira no Asomi.

sen.j: また、武家台頭による下級貴族の没落もあり、朝臣は、序列付けの為の姓（かばね）としての意味を失ってしまい、公式文書で使う形式的なものになっていった。
sen.e: Also, with the fall of lower-ranked nobles due to the rise of the warrior class to power, Ason of the Kabane lost its meaning as one of Kabane titles used for ranking nobility's status and it became a formality which was used for official documents.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Also, with the fall of lower-ranked nobles due to the rise of the warrior class to power, Asomi lost its meaning in the sense of kabane used to rank status, and it became a formality which was used for official documents.
sen.cmt: 翻訳を一部修正しました。
sen.e: Also, with the fall of lower-ranked nobles due to the rise of the warrior class to power, Asomi lost its meaning in the sense of kabane used to rank status, and it became a formality which was used for official documents.

sen.j: 家格順に藤原氏、源氏、平氏、橘氏等。
sen.e: The high ranking nobles in Kakaku (family status) were Fujiwara, Minamoto, Taira, Tachibana clans and others in that order.
The high ranking nobles in the family status were Fujiwara, Minamoto, Taira, Tachibana clans and others in that order.
sen.cmt: kakaku を削除し、英語のみとしました。
sen.e: The high ranking nobles in the family status were Fujiwara, Minamoto, Taira, Tachibana clans and others in that order.

sen.j: 平安時代以降、公卿(三位以上及び参議)、氏の下に朝臣、諱の下に公(大臣)ないし卿という敬称を以って称した。
sen.e: From the Heian Period, the title of honor Ason was named after Kugyo (Sanmi or higher also Sangi) and Uji as well as Kou (Daijin) or kyou was named after Imina.
sen.cmt: 「･･･公卿(三位以上及び参議)、氏の下に朝臣･･･」の「、」は『と（＝and）』であると意味解釈し英訳しました。
sen.e: From the Heian period, a person who was kugyo (sanmi [third court rank] or higher and sangi [councilor]) was called by putting Ason after his uji (clan name) as well as putting a honorific title as ko (minister) or kyo (minister) after his imina (real personal name).
sen.cmt: ここでは「公卿」の人の呼ばれ方を説明しているため、a person who was kugyo としました。
sen.e: From the Heian period, a person who was kugyo (sanmi [third court rank] or higher and sangi [councilor]) was called by putting Ason after his uji (clan name) as well as putting a honorific title as ko (minister) or kyo (minister) after his imina (real personal name).

sen.j: 四位以上の者は氏、諱の下に朝臣とつけて呼称した。
sen.e: A person who was Shii (Fourth Court Rank) named Ason after Uji or Imina.
A person who was shii (fourth court rank) or higher was called by putting Ason after his uji or imina.
sen.cmt: 四位「以上」 を追加しました。
sen.e: A person who was shii (fourth court rank) or higher was called by putting Ason after his uji or imina.

sen.j: 氏ではなく諱の下に朝臣とつけることを名乗り朝臣という。
sen.e: Naming Ason after Imina instead of Uji refers to Nanori Ason.
Putting Ason after his imina instead of uji refers to Nanori Ason.
Putting Ason after his imina instead of uji refers to Nanori Ason.
